Grieving family want answers after unexplained death of child sex offender in Northland prison https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/griving-family-want-answers-after-unexplained-death-of-child-sex-offender-in-northland-prison/2GM673BABJFWTEA4BWFFEJH3AA/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/griving-family-want-answers-after-unexplained-death-of-child-sex-offender-in-northland-prison/2GM673BABJFWTEA4BWFFEJH3AA/ Lane NicholsThe family say they found unusual marks on the inmate's body. Mon, 23 Dec 2024 16:00:00 +0000 Kingi Hemi, 40, died in Ngawha Prison on November 20 while serving a six-year sentence for child sex offences. His death is 'unexplained'.
Auckland couple welcome son after baby daughter’s Kabuki Syndrome death https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/auckland- Couple-welcome-son-after-baby-daughters-kabuki-syndrome-death/QHLR3HAGOZCMJCEC5UJY6JVKJQ/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/auckland- Couple-welcome-son-after-baby-daughters-kabuki-syndrome-death/QHLR3HAGOZCMJCEC5UJY6JVKJQ/ Cherie Howie'We’ll always be a family with three kids, even if one is not around,' Dad says. Mon, 23 Dec 2024 17:19:22 +0000 Nicolas Zubok and Michele Roxo lost their four-month-old baby Iris Roxo Zubok in August 2023, as a result of ailments connected to Kabuki syndrome. On December 17th Michele gave birth to their son Noah, who they are calling their 'rainbow baby'. Also pictured is older sister Eva. Photo / Sylvie Whinray
Gang patch ban: Who are the Damned Pirates, Fitus and H-Town 07, subject to the new law? https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/gang-patch-ban-who-are-the-damned-pirates-fitus-and-h-town-07-subject-to-the-new-law/ L3LCATFPRZAIDOSF6BALIFO7PI/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/gang-patch-ban-who-are-the-damned-pirates-fitus-and-h-town-07-subject-to-the-new-law/ L3LCATFPRZAIDOSF6BALIFO7PI/ George BlockPolice intel files reveal fresh details on little-known Kiwi gangs subject to new law. Mon, 23 Dec 2024 16:00:00 +0000 An image of the Fitus logo that appears in the police intelligence report on the gang. The "276" refers to the Otahuhu area code, as does "OtaBlue", with the blue referring to the colour favoured by the Crips and affiliated gangs - as does "We Steady Crippin'".
Tourism heavy hitters told Auckland Mayor Wayne his CCO reforms stood to lose $2m for mayor events https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/tourism-heavy-hitters-told-auckland-mayor-wayne-his-cco-reforms-stood-to-lose-2m-for-mayor-events/3JD56SYC7FFKRG4PG3OT3TS4GI/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/tourism-heavy-hitters-told-auckland-mayor-wayne-his-cco-reforms-stood-to-lose-2m-for-mayor-events/3JD56SYC7FFKRG4PG3OT3TS4GI/ Bernard OrsmanThe mayor changed his plans after hearing from tourism bosses. Mon, 23 Dec 2024 16:00:00 +0000 The letter said Auckland destination marketing and major events could lose $2m of private funding. Photo / Alex Burton
Legislation, losers and lessons: Andrew Bayly’s 2024 https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/politics/legislation-losers-and-lessons-andrew-baylys-2024/52UJGDXZH5GNXIMAZ6HELPG2F4/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/politics/legislation-losers-and-lessons-andrew-baylys-2024/52UJGDXZH5GNXIMAZ6HELPG2F4/ Tom RaynelMinister Andrew Bayly sat down with Tom Raynel to discuss his 2024, and what comes next. Mon, 23 Dec 2024 16:00:00 +0000 Minister Andrew Bayly has had a rollercoaster year, from legislative agenda progress to a ministerial visit blunder. He spoke with Tom Raynel about his year gone by, and what 2025 has in store. New Zealand Herald photograph by Mark Mitchell
Sharemarket full of cheer in leadup to Christmas https://www.nzherald.co.nz/business/sharemarket-full-of-cheer-in-leadup-to-christmas/4PIY6HCGOZCZRGR5C54BVKBL6U/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/business/sharemarket-full-of-cheer-in-leadup-to-christmas/4PIY6HCGOZCZRGR5C54BVKBL6U/ Graham SkellernVolumes were lighter as investors are thinking more about the summer holidays.
